common.phaseBannerHTML: This is a new service – your feedback will help us to improve it.

permitType.defaultTitle: What type of permit or certificate are you applying for?
permitType.pageHeader: What type of permit or certificate are you applying for?
permitType.radioOptionImportHint: To move a specimen to the United Kingdom (or between Great Britain and Northern Ireland)
permitType.radioOptionExportHint: To move a specimen out of the United Kingdom (or between Great Britain and Northern Ireland)
permitType.radioOptionReexportHint: To move a previously imported specimen out of the United Kingdom (or between Great Britain and Northern Ireland)
permitType.radioOptionArticle10Hint: To use any specimen of an GB/EU Annex A species for commercial purposes within the United Kingdom

errorMessages.error.permitType.any.required: Select the type of permit or certificate that you are applying for
errorMessages.error.permitType.any.only: Select the type of permit or certificate that you are applying for

cannotUseService.pageTitle: You cannot use this service yet
cannotUseService.pageHeader: You cannot use this service yet
cannotUseService.pageBody: You can only use this service to apply for:
cannotUseService.link: Check how to apply for other CITES permits and certificates

applyingOnBehalf.defaultTitle: Are you applying on behalf of someone else?
applyingOnBehalf.pageHeader: Are you applying on behalf of someone else?
applyingOnBehalf.pageBody1: Select ‘yes’ if you are completing this application:

bulletListItems.bulletListItem: for a friend or family member

applyingOnBehalf.pageBody2: Select ‘no’ if you are completing this application on behalf of yourself, your business or the business that you work for.

errorMessages.error.isAgent.any.required: Select yes if you are applying on behalf of someone else
errorMessages.error.isAgent.any.only: Select yes if you are applying on behalf of someone else

selectDeliveryAddress.radioOptionDeliverToDifferentAddress: Deliver the permit to a different address

deliveryType.defaultTitle: How do you want your permit to be delivered?
deliveryType.pageHeader: How do you want your permit to be delivered?
deliveryType.hintText: If you have selected Royal Mail Special Delivery the additional fee for this will be calculated when your application is processed

speciesName.defaultTitle: What is the scientific name of the species?
speciesName.pageHeader: What is the scientific name of the species?
speciesName.bodyText1: Enter the exact scientific name. You can search for the scientific name on Species+ (opens in a new tab).
speciesName.bodyText2: If you are applying for a hybrid species that is not listed, please enter 'Plant Hybrid' or 'Animal Hybrid'.
speciesName.bodyText3: Applications made using this selection will be rejected if the species name is listed.

couldNotConfirm.pageTitle: We could not confirm the scientific name
couldNotConfirm.pageHeader: We could not confirm the scientific name
couldNotConfirm.bodyText1: We have been unable to confirm your scientific name, please check your spelling is correct. If you are unable to find its name and it is a hybrid then please enter 'Plant Hybrid' or 'Animal Hybrid'.
couldNotConfirm.bodyText2: You can check scientific names on Species+ (opens in a new tab)

animal.radioOptionRHint: Reared in a controlled environment (taken as eggs or juveniles from the wild)
animal.radioOptionDHint: Animals bred in captivity by a CITES registered breeder
animal.radioOptionCHint: Animals bred in captivity to second generation specimens or that meet the Commission Regulation criteria (opens in a new tab)
animal.radioOptionFHint: Animals born in captivity to first generation specimens or that do not meet the Commission Regulation criteria (opens in a new tab)
animal.radioOptionXHint: Taken from the marine environment not under the jurisdiction of any State (sometime known as the high seas)

anotherSourceCodes.text: R - Reared in a controlled environment (taken as eggs or juveniles from the wild)
D - Animals bred in captivity by a CITES registered breeder
C - Animals bred in captivity to second generation specimens or that meet the Commission Regulation criteria
F - Animals born in captivity to first generation specimens or that do not meet the Commission Regulation criteria
X - Taken from the marine environment not under the jurisdiction of any State (sometime known as the high seas)

errorMessages.error.enterAReason.string.pattern.base: Reason must only include letters a to z, numbers 0 to 9, and special characters such as hyphens, spaces and apostrophes
errorMessages.error.enterAReason.string.max: Reason must be 300 characters or less

plant.radioOptionDHint: Plants artificially propagated for commercial purposes
plant.radioOptionAHint: Plants artificially propagated for non-commercial purposes
plant.radioOptionXHint: Taken from the marine environment not under the jurisdiction of any State (sometime known as the high seas)
plant.radioOptionYHint: Plants that meet the definition for assisted production (opens in a new tab)

anotherSourceCodes.text: D - Plants artificially propagated for commercial purposes
A - Plants artificially propagated for non-commercial purposes
X - Taken from the marine environment not under the jurisdiction of any State (sometime known as the high seas)
Y - Plants that meet the definition for assisted production

errorMessages.error.enterAReason.string.pattern.base: Reason must only include letters a to z, numbers 0 to 9, and special characters such as hyphens, spaces and apostrophes
errorMessages.error.enterAReason.string.max: Reason must be 300 characters or less

purposeCode.radioOptionBHint: Breeding in captivity or artificial propagation
purposeCode.radioOptionNHint: Reintroduction or introduction into the wild

specimenOrigin.defaultTitle: Where did the specimen come from?
specimenOrigin.pageHeader: Where did the specimen come from?
specimenOrigin.hintText: I hereby certify that the specimens described above:
specimenOrigin.radioOptionA: were taken from the wild in accordance with the legislation in force in the United Kingdom
specimenOrigin.radioOptionB: are abandoned or escaped specimens that were recovered in accordance with the legislation in force in the United Kingdom
specimenOrigin.radioOptionC: are captive born-and-bred or artificially propagated specimens
specimenOrigin.radioOptionD: were acquired in or introduced into a Member State in compliance with the provisions of Council Regulation (EC) No 338/97 as it had effect immediately before IP completion day
specimenOrigin.radioOptionE: were acquired in or introduced into a Member State before 1 June 1997 in accordance with Council Regulation (EEC) No 3626/82
specimenOrigin.radioOptionF: were acquired in or introduced into a Member State before 1 January 1984 in compliance with the provisions of CITES
specimenOrigin.radioOptionG: were acquired in or introduced into the United Kingdom before the provisions of Regulations (EC) No 338/97 (as it had effect immediately before IP completion day) or (EEC) No 3626/82 or of CITES became applicable in this territory.

errorMessages.error.specimenOrigin.any.required: Select where the specimen came from

useCertificateFor.defaultTitle: What will you use the certificate for?
useCertificateFor.pageHeader: What will you use the certificate for?
useCertificateFor.radioOptionLegallyAcquired: To prove that you legally acquired a specimen
useCertificateFor.radioOptionCommercialActivities: To use the specimen for commercial activities
useCertificateFor.radioOptionNonDetrimentalPurposes: To use the specimen for science, breeding, propagation, research, education or other non-detrimental purposes
useCertificateFor.radioOptionDisplayWithoutSale: To display the specimen to the public without sale
useCertificateFor.radioOptionMoveALiveSpecimen: To move a live specimen within Great Britain

errorMessages.error.useCertificateFor.any.required: Select what you will use the certificate for

specimenType.radioOptionAnimalWorked: A worked item or finished product
specimenType.radioOptionPlantProductHint: Any plant body or part that was removed from its natural habitat to make a product. For example, seeds, fruits, roots, stems, flowers or leaves, including extracts or powders.
specimenType.radioOptionPlantWorked: A worked item or finished product
specimenType.radioOptionPlantWorkedHint: A specimen that has been significantly altered from its natural raw state and used for items such as furniture, jewellery, carved figures or musical instruments.

errorMessages.error.specimenType.any.only: Select what best describes the specimen
errorMessages.error.specimenType.any.required: Select what best describes the specimen

tradeTermCode.defaultTitle: What is the CITES trade term code

tradeTermCode.pageBody: You can find more information on each trade term code ​in Annex A of the guidance (opens in a new tab)

errorMessages.error.tradeTermCode.string.length: Trade term code must be 3 characters
errorMessages.error.tradeTermCode.string.pattern.base: Enter a trade term code using letters a to z

uploadSupportingDocuments.pageBody1: You should add any documents that may support your application. For example, you can upload:

bulletList1Items.bulletListItem: an Article 10 certificate for the specimen’s parents
proof of ownership or how you acquired the specimen

uploadSupportingDocuments.agentBulletListItem: permission to act on the applicant’s behalf
uploadSupportingDocuments.pageBody2a: You are allowed to upload up to
uploadSupportingDocuments.pageBody2b: files, provided that each file is less than 10MB in size and meets one of the following criteria
uploadSupportingDocuments.spanNoFilesUploaded: You have not uploaded any files

errorMessages.error.fileUpload.hapi.headers.content-ty: The selected file must be a word document, pdf, jpeg or png
errorMessages.error.fileUpload.any.existing: A file with this name has already been uploaded
errorMessages.error.fileUpload.any.maxfiles: Maximum number of supporting documents reached

errorMessages.error.file.delete.exception: The selected file could not be removed – try again
errorMessages.error.fileUpload.any.filesize: The selected file must be smaller than 10MB

applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenOriginA: were taken from the wild in accordance with the legislation in force in the United Kingdom
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenOriginB: are abandoned or escaped specimens that were recovered in accordance with the legislation in force in the United Kingdom
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenOriginC: are captive born-and-bred or artificially propagated specimens
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenOriginD: were acquired in or introduced into a Member State in compliance with the provisions of Council Regulation (EC) No 338/97 as it had effect immediately before IP completion day
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenOriginE: were acquired in or introduced into a Member State before 1 June 1997 in accordance with Council Regulation (EEC) No 3626/82
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenOriginF: were acquired in or introduced into a Member State before 1 January 1984 in compliance with the provisions of CITES
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenOriginG: were acquired in or introduced into the United Kingdom before the provisions of Regulations (EC) No 338/97 (as it had effect immediately before IP completion day) or (EEC) No 3626/82 or of CITES became applicable in this territory.
applicationSummary.rowTextLegallyAcquired: To prove that you legally acquired a specimen
applicationSummary.rowTextCommercialActivities: To use the specimen for commercial activities
applicationSummary.rowTextNonDetrimentalPurposes: To use the specimen for science, breeding, propagation, research, education or other non-detrimental purposes
applicationSummary.rowTextDisplayWithoutSale: To display the specimen to the public without sale
applicationSummary.rowTextMoveALiveSpecimen: To move a live specimen within Great Britain
applicationSummary.headerPermitDetailsFromExportIntoGreatBr: Permit details from export into Great Britain
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeR: Reared in a controlled environment (taken as eggs or juveniles from the wild)
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeDAnimal: Animals bred in captivity by a CITES registered breeder
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeDPlant: Plants artificially propagated for commercial purposes
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeC: Animals bred in captivity to second generation specimens or that meet the Commission Regulation criteria
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeF: Animals born in captivity to first generation specimens or that do not meet the Commission Regulation criteria
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeA: Plants artificially propagated for non-commercial purposes
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeX: Taken from the marine environment not under the jurisdiction of any State (sometime known as the high seas)
applicationSummary.rowTextSourceCodeY: Plants that meet the definition for assisted production
applicationSummary.rowTextPurposeCodeB: Breeding in captivity or artificial propagation
applicationSummary.rowTextPurposeCodeN: Reintroduction or introduction into the wild
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenTypeAnimalWorked: A worked item or finished product
applicationSummary.rowTextSpecimenTypePlantWorked: A worked item or finished product

paid.pageBody1: We have received your application fee and have sent you a confirmation email.
paid.pageBody2: We have passed your application to the APHA team for endangered plant and animal species (CITES). APHA aims to process your application within 30 days. They may contact you if they require more information.
paid.pageBody3: To view the status of your application, go to your CITES account. There may be a short delay before the application appears in your list of applications.

simple.pageBody1: We have passed your application to the APHA team for endangered plant and animal species (CITES).
simple.pageBody2: Your application will not be processed until payment has been received
simple.pageBody3: To pay for your application, go to your CITES account. There may be a short delay before the application appears in your list of applications.

complex.pageBody1: We have passed your application to the APHA team for endangered plant and animal species (CITES).
complex.pageBody2: They will contact you to confirm the amount you need to pay.
complex.pageBody3: Your application will not be processed until payment has been received.
complex.pageBody4: To view the status of your application, go to your CITES account. There may be a short delay before the application appears in your list of applications.

paymentProblem.defaultTitle: Sorry, there was a problem with the payment

paymentProblem.pageBody: You can try again. No money has been taken from your account.
paymentProblem.goBackAndTryAgainLinkText: Go back to try the payment again

privacy.heading2: What personal data is collected, and how it is used
privacy.heading3: How your data has been obtained
privacy.heading4: Why Defra and APHA are using your data
privacy.heading5: The legal basis for processing your data
privacy.heading6: A law-based requirement to provide personal data
privacy.heading7: What happens if you do not provide the necessary data
privacy.heading8: Who Defra and APHA share your data with
privacy.heading9: How long Defra and APHA hold personal data
privacy.pageBodyText1: The data controller is the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra). The Animal and Plant Health Agency (APHA), an executive agency of Defra will collect your data.
privacy.pageBodyText2: If you have any questions about how Defra uses your data or your associated rights, email Defra’s Data Protection Manager data.protection@Defra.gov.uk
privacy.pageBodyText3: The Data Protection Officer responsible for monitoring that Defra is meeting the requirements of the legislation can be contacted by email at: DefraGroupDataProtectionOfficer@Defra.gov.uk.
privacy.pageBodyText4: Defra and APHA will use personal data that you or someone authorised to act on your behalf provide. The personal data that we process are your name, email address and postal address. We also process details of your CITES specimen to:

bulletList1Items.bulletListItem: issue a CITES permit where applicable
comply with and enforce the CITES international agreement

privacy.pageBodyText5: If you complete a registration or application on behalf of someone else, we will also collect and process your name, email address and postal address.
privacy.pageBodyText6: We have obtained your data from your application for CITES permits to move or trade endangered species. This data is provided either from you directly or someone authorised to act on your behalf.
privacy.pageBodyText7: When you apply for CITES permits to move or trade endangered species, we will use your data to check that you comply with and to enforce the agreement.
privacy.pageBodyText8: We will share your data when we review your application, so that an expert from our scientific authorities can assess the application.

bulletList2Items.bulletListItem: contact you or someone acting on your behalf to request further information on the application
contact you to tell you an application has been made on your behalf
contact you if we suspect that your specimen does not comply with CITES
check that you or someone acting on your behalf complies with CITES

privacy.pageBodyText10: Where APHA uses your data to check that the specimen complies with CITES, the legal basis for this data use is described in Article 6 (1) (e) of the UK GDPR. Article 6 (1) (e) relates to the processing of your data necessary for the exercise of official authority vested in the controller (Defra and APHA), as stated in the Wildlife trade regulations.
privacy.pageBodyText11: You are required by law to provide your data to APHA so they can ensure that any movement or trade of endangered species is compliant with CITES under the Wildlife trade regulations.
privacy.pageBodyText12: You are required by law to provide your data to APHA so they can ensure that any movement or trade of endangered species is compliant with CITES. There is a statutory requirement for you to provide your personal data.
privacy.pageBodyText13: Without necessary data, we will not be able to process your application for a permit. You will not be able to move or trade the specimen within your application.
privacy.pageBodyText14: We will share your data with APHA and Defra to give their expert opinion on whether the item meets the exemption criteria.
privacy.pageBodyText15: Your personal data is shared with assessors to review your application, as well as third parties including JNCC, Kew and Border Force.
privacy.pageBodyText16: We will not share your data with any other third parties, except where we are required to do so by law or court order, to detect or prevent crime, or to apprehend or prosecute offenders.
privacy.pageBodyText17: Under CITES, there is a statutory requirement for us to hold data on CITES where an applicant has applied for a permit. This application would have been under the provisions governing exemptions in the agreement.
privacy.pageBodyText18: Personal data will be held for seven years from the date we receive your application. It will be reviewed to determine whether a further retention period is required to ensure compliance with and appropriate enforcement of CITES. Data will be manually deleted once it has been determined it is appropriate to do so.
privacy.pageBodyText19: Find out about your individual rights under the UK General Data Protection Regulation (UK GDPR) and the Data Protection Act 2018 (DPA 2018).
privacy.pageBodyText20: You have the right to make a complaint to the Information Commissioner’s Office at any time.
privacy.pageBodyText21: Defra’s personal information charter, which also applies to APHA’s use of personal data, explains more about your rights over your personal data. This Charter broadly sets out Defra’s standards for requesting or storing personal information.

cookies.pageBodyText1: Cookies are small files saved on your phone, tablet or computer when you visit a website.
cookies.pageBodyText2: We use cookies to make CITES work and collect information about how you use our service.
cookies.pageBodyText3: Essential cookies keep your information secure while you use CITES. We do not need to ask permission to use them.
cookies.tableRow2: To store details you enter on this site

accessibility.defaultTitle: Accessibility statement for ‘Apply for a CITES permit' to move or trade endangered species
accessibility.pageHeader: Accessibility statement for ‘Apply for a CITES permit' to move or trade endangered species
accessibility.heading4: Technical information about this service’s accessibility
accessibility.pageBodyText1: This accessibility statement applies to the digital service of the ‘Apply for a CITES permit' to move or trade endangered species.
accessibility.pageBodyText2: This service is run by the Department for Environment, Farming and Rural Affairs (Defra). We want as many people as possible to be able to use this service. For example, that means you should be able to:

bulletList1Items.bulletListItem: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
navigate most of the service using just a keyboard
navigate most of the service using speech recognition software
listen to most of the service using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)

accessibility.pageBodyText3: We’ve also made the text in the service as simple as possible to understand.
accessibility.pageBodyText4: AbilityNet has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
accessibility.pageBodyText5: This service has been tested internally by the team developing it. It has also been developed using GOV.UK patterns, which are rigorously tested for accessibility issues.

bulletList2Items.bulletListItem: find any problems not listed on this page or think we’re not meeting accessibility requirements

accessibility.pageBodyText8: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the ‘accessibility regulations’). If you’re not happy with how we respond to your complaint, contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS).
accessibility.pageBodyText9: Defra is committed to making this service accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
accessibility.pageBodyText10: This statement was prepared on 15 May 2023.
